AST101.name: The Celestial Clockworks
AST101.description: Relationship between ancient skylore and timekeeping. Establishment of a calendar and celestial navigation. Development of the Greek horoscope as a time recorder and coordinate system.

AST207.name: The Science of Astronomy
AST207.description: In-depth study of one topic in astronomy with emphasis on key discoveries. Topics may be cosmology, the solar system, and the life of stars.
AST207.prerequisite: ((PHY 231 or concurrently) or (PHY 231C or concurrently) or (PHY 183 or concurrently) or (PHY 183B or concurrently) or (ISP 205 or concurrently) or (LB 273 or concurrently)) and ((MTH 114 or concurrently) or (MTH 116 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently))

AST208.name: Planets and Telescopes
AST208.description: Origin and nature of the solar system. Planets of the solar system and other star systems. Determination of time and celestial coordinates. Astronomical instruments and observational methods.
AST208.prerequisite: (PHY 183 or PHY 183B or PHY 193H or LB 273) and ((MTH 103 or concurrently) or (MTH 114 or concurrently) or (MTH 116 or concurrently) or (MTH 132 or concurrently) or (LB 118 or concurrently))

AST304.name: Stars
AST304.description: Physical processes that determine the structure and evolution of stars. Observations of stars and star clusters. Spectra of stars.
AST304.prerequisite: AST 208 and (PHY 215 or PHY 215B) and (PHY 321 or concurrently)

AST308.name: Galaxies and Cosmology
AST308.description: The Milky Way. Structure and content of galaxies. Active galaxies and quasars. The expanding universe. Modern cosmological models.
AST308.prerequisite: (AST 208) and ((PHY 215 or concurrently) or PHY 215B) and (PHY 321 or concurrently)

AST310.name: Directed Studies
AST310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AST310.description: Individual study or project in astronomy or astrophysics under the direction of a faculty member.

AST410.name: Senior Thesis
AST410.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AST410.description: Design and execute an original experiment or computation. A written and oral report of the research is required.
AST410.prerequisite: (AST 301) and completion of Tier I writing requirement.

AST800.name: Research Methods
AST800.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AST800.description: Apprenticeship in astrophysical research. Student will work closely with faculty member to learn research techniques.

AST805.name: Research Project
AST805.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AST805.description: Research project to be completed under the guidance of an astronomy faculty member.

AST810.name: Radiation Astrophysics
AST810.description: Transfer of radiation through plasmas and processes for emission and absorption of photons. Interpretation of the spectra of stars, the interstellar medium, and galaxies.

AST820.name: Advanced Topics in Astrophysics
AST820.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
AST820.description: Advanced work in a specialized astrophysical topic.

AST825.name: Galactic Astronomy
AST825.description: The Milky Way as a galaxy. Observations and techniques of theoretical analysis that are used to discover the features of our galaxy.

AST835.name: Extragalactic Astronomy
AST835.description: Galaxies beyond the Milky Way. Large-scale structure of the universe. Cosmology.

AST840.name: Stellar Astrophysics
AST840.description: Physics of stellar interiors. Methods for calculating stellar models. Principles of stellar evolution.

AST850.name: Electrodynamics of Plasmas
AST850.description: Plasma kinetic and macroscopic plasma transport theory. Electromagnetic wave propagation and charged particle diffusion processes in plasma. Electromagnetic energy absorption via elastic and inelastic collisions. Dc, rf, and microwave discharges.

AST860.name: Gravitational Astrophysics
AST860.description: Experimental foundations, theory, and applications of gravitational physics and general relativity. Tests of the equivalence principle, modern solar system tests of general relativity, Schwarzschild metric, Hawking effect, Einstein's field equations.

AST899.name: Master's Thesis Research
AST899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AST899.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Astronomy and Astrophysics major.

AST911.name: Numerical Techniques in Astronomy
AST911.description: Numerical solutions to key problems in astronomy and astrophysics. N-body gravitational calculations, hydrodynamics in astronomy, radiative transfer, and techniques for large datasets. Offered first half of semester.
AST911.prerequisite: PHY 810 and PHY 820 or approval of department

AST999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
AST999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
AST999.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Astrophysics and Astronomy Major.
